definitions: Obsolete spelling of pôr, now a common misspelling
etymology: Merger of Old Portuguese por, from Vulgar Latin *por, from Latin prō (“for”) (with metathetic shift due to per), and Old Portuguese per, from Latin per (“through, by”).
pronunciations:
(Brazil) IPA(key): /puʁ/, /poʁ/
(Paulista) IPA(key): /puɾ/, /puɹ/, /poɾ/, /poɹ/
(South Brazil) IPA(key): /poɾ/, /poɻ/, /puɾ/, /puɻ/
Homophone: pôr (with /o/)
